xtrememp.visualization

Class SpectrumBars

  • java.lang.Object
    • xtrememp.visualization.AbstractVisualization
      • xtrememp.visualization.AbstractSpectrumAnalyzer
        • xtrememp.visualization.SpectrumBars
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractVisualization>

    public final class SpectrumBars
extends AbstractSpectrumAnalyzer
    Renders a spectrum analyzer. Based on the KJ-DSS project by Kris Fudalewski at http://fudcom.com/main/libs/kjdss/.

      • setBandCount

        public void setBandCount(int count)
        Sets the numbers of bands rendered by the spectrum analyzer.
        Parameters:
        count - Cannot be more than half the "FFT window length".

      • calculateFrequencyTable

        public static float[] calculateFrequencyTable(int spectrumLength,
                                              float sampleRate)
        Calculates a table of frequencies represented by the spectral bin values returned from the FFT processing. Each element states the end of the frequency range of the corresponding FFT bin. For example: Range of bin 0 = 0.0 Hz to freqTable[0] Hz Range of bin 1 = freqTable[0] Hz to freqTable[1] Hz Range of bin 2 = freqTable[1] Hz to freqTable[2] Hz ... and so on.
        Parameters:
        spectrumLength -
        sampleRate - The audio sample rate used to calculate the frequency table (usually the sample rate of the input to the FFT calculate method). Typically sampleRate = 44,100 samples per second.
        Returns:
        An array of frequency limits for each band.
